AstroObjectEntry:
GIANTS_DEEP
SCROLL_WORKSHOP Scroll and Stone Workshop Stowaway
Workshop R1
A new invention from the Scroll and Stone Workshop on Giant's Deep was used to enter the Sanctuary, in place of a warp receiver.
Workshop R2 A new invention from this workshop allowed Nomai to walk beyond any projection pools they peered through.
Workshop R3 Projection stones were crafted at this workshop on Giant's Deep.
Workshop R4 GD_STATUE_ISLAND Nomai scrolls and projection stones were crafted at this workshop on Statue Island.
Workshop EX1 Nomai scrolls and projection stones were crafted at this workshop.
Workshop EX2 Voyager stones use memory statues to record experiences from the projection pool.
Workshop EX3 Memories recorded by memory statues are sent back in time at the end of each loop.
Workshop EX4 Memories past the end-of-cycle transmission cannot be sent back. This is indicated by a static vision at the end of the loop.
Workshop EX5 Conversations written using projection stones are recorded on projection walls at both ends of the conversation, not the stone itself.
Workshop EX6 Information stored within projection walls can only be retrieved using the corresponding projection stones.
SCROLL_WORKSHOP_TOP Workshop Loft Stowaway
WorkshopTop R1 There is a second floor of the Scroll and Stone Workshop that is too high to reach. The doorway is blocked by a downward-traveling Nomai elevator.
WorkshopTop EX1
A Nomai named Daz was cut off while writing to the Deep Storm Station about the failure of the Ash Twin Project.
WorkshopTop EX2
Daz feared that the lifeforms sheltered within the Sanctuary had escaped using the quantum shard.
WorkshopTop EX3 The Nomai were unable to completely evacuate the species within the Sanctuary due to the species' amphibious nature, which allowed them to evade Nomai voyagers by staying underwater.
///
PIONEER_BEACH Statue Island Beach None
Pioneer EX1 This beach was where Nomai landed on their first survey expedition to Giant's Deep.
Pioneer EX2 The Nomai moved their camp into the island's interior to seek shelter from the planet's storms.
PIONEER_CAMP_INTERIOR Pioneer Interior Camp None
Pioneer_Int R1 The Nomai moved their camp into the island's interior to seek shelter from the planet's storms.
Pioneer_Int EX1 The Nomai exploring Giant's Deep discovered an island which remains entirely clear of the cyclones' path.
Pioneer_Int EX2 The Nomai decided to relocate to and settle on the stormless island, until they could find other ways to protect themselves from cyclones.
Pioneer_Int EX3 A new invention called the storm shelter protected Nomai on Giant's Deep from cyclones.
Pioneer_Int EX4 Nomai noticed storm shelters powering on by themselves in the absence of cyclones, though they were supposed to only activate in the presence of cyclones.
///
CONSTRUCT_BAY Construction Bay Stowaway
CB_R1 The Deep Storm Station's warp pad is located on the Construction Yard.
CB_R2 A Nomai named Cassava noticed ghost matter at this site disappearing at times. They decided to study and record their findings on the other side of the Construction Bay.
CB_R3 DEEP_STORM_STATION A Nomai named Cassava was protected by the property of immersion aboard the Deep Storm Station.
CB_R4 GD_CONSTRUCTION_YARD A bay on the lower part of the Construction Yard.
CB_EX1 The lower bay of the Construction Yard. One side is flooded by ghost matter.
CB_EX2 A Nomai named Cassava observed ghost matter being temporarily neutralized when immersed by waves washing onto the island. This property was named the 'property of immersion'.
CB_EX3 Cassava was protected by the property of immersion aboard the Deep Storm Station. He vowed to learn more about ghost matter and its source in the time he had left.
///
LOVERSCOVE Jellyfish Study Cove Stowaway
Cove R1 Ghost Matter Cove There is a small cove on Gabbro's Island flooded by ghost matter.
Cove R2 The Nomai were discovered a beached jellyfish on this island. They took shelter from a cyclone inside the nearby cove, before continuing their research.
Cove EX1 A small cove inside Gabbro's Island filled with ghost matter.
Cove EX2 The Nomai were intrigued how a jellyfish reached the surface of Giant's Deep.
Cove EX3 The Nomai decided to visit the Deep Storm Station to survey the population of jellyfish from below Giant's Deep's ocean current.
Cove EX4 The warp pad to the Deep Storm Station is located on the Construction Yard.
LOOMINGCITY Looming City Stowaway
LC R1 PIONEER_CAMP_INTERIOR Nomai living on Giant's Deep used to be completely insulated from cyclones in the Looming City.
LC R2 The Nomai abandoned this tower after a quantum shard caused its interior to become inhospitably quantum.
LC EX1 A great tower that once served as a Nomai settlement.
LC EX2 The Nomai abandoned this tower due to extenuating circumstances, chronicled in scrolls within the tower.
The Nomai abandoned this tower after its interior became quantum. They relocated to the island they first arrived on for its high cliffs. LC R2
LC EX3 "Objects left on a quantum shard will travel with the shard."
LC EX4 The Nomai discovered that observing an image of a quantum object locks the quantum object in superposition.
LC EX5 Days last three times longer on islands in the northern hemisphere, as they sail against the rotation of Giant's Deep.
DEEP_STORM_STATION Deep Storm Station
Stowaway
Irradiated Station
DSS Probe My scout was warped into some sort of underwater Nomai station flooded with ghost matter. I could see purple electricity outside the viewport.
DSS R2
Irradiated Station I was warped into some sort of underwater Nomai station flooded with ghost matter. I could see purple electricity outside the viewport.
DSS R6 A Nomai mural depicts the Deep Storm Station as being comprised of a lower and upper module.
DSS R3
Deep Storm Station 1 A Nomai described the Deep Storm Station as "a project concerning the safety of their clan and the star system."
DSS R4
Deep Storm Station 1 The Deep Storm Station used energy from Giant's Deep's electric core to test the mechanisms of the negative time interval.
DSS R5 Deep Storm Station
1 SCROLL_WORKSHOP A Nomai named Daz was cut off while writing to the Deep Storm Station from the Scroll and Stone Workshop.
DSS R8 INSPIRED The Inspired's construction used a whitehole warp core from the Deep Storm Station's paired warp cores.
DSS R7 LOVERSCOVE The Nomai decided to visit the Deep Storm Station to survey the population of jellyfish from below Giant's Deep's ocean current.
DSS R9 TT_TIME_LOOP_DEVICE The Nomai used the Deep Storm Station to see 6 seconds into the future after the Ash Twin Project was launched.
DSS EX1 An underwater Nomai station deep within Giant's Deep.
An underwater Nomai station built to test the mechanisms of the Ash Twin Project, using energy from Giant's Deep's electric core. DSS R4
DSS EX2 A Nomai named Cassava located the source of ghost matter and became curious about recreating it, using a comet as a model.
A Nomai named Cassava explored the Interloper and became curious about recreating it, using the Interloper as a model. COMET_INTERIOR_X3
DSS EX6 Cassava learned that a hostile comet came from a barren asteroid belt far outside any star system. He resolved to launch the Inspired regardless, to protect the surviving species of the star system.
Cassava learned that the Interloper came from a barren asteroid belt far outside any star system. He resolved to launch the Inspired regardless, to protect the surviving species of the star system. COMET_INTERIOR_X3
DSS EX7 The Nomai used the Deep Storm Station to see 6 seconds into the future after the Ash Twin Project was launched. They were disappointed to learn that the Ash Twin Project had failed to launch.
COMET_MURAL Comet Mural
Stowaway
DSS EX3 The Inspired was a superweapon built to exact vengeance on the true source of ghost matter. Using gravity crystals, it powered a highly localized gravity field to exploit the property of attraction.
The Inspired was a superweapon built to exact vengeance on the source of the Interloper. Using gravity crystals, it powered a highly localized gravity field to exploit the property of attraction. COMET_INTERIOR_X3
DSS EX4 The Inspired used a white-hole warp core from the Deep Storm Station's paired warp cores, disabling the station indefinitely.
DSS EX5 There were entry points left at the front of the Inspired due to an insufficient amount of gravity crystals.
DSS_BASEMENT Power Module
Stowaway
DSS_B EX0 The lower module of the Deep Storm Station. The energy cables from the exterior appear to be powering a white hole at the center of the station.
DSS_B EX1 A Nomai named Cassava was protected from some sort of danger aboard the Deep Storm Station. He used voyager stones to travel outside the station safely.
A Nomai named Cassava survived the arrival of ghost matter aboard the Deep Storm Station. He used voyager stones to travel outside the station safely. COMET_INTERIOR_X3
DSS_B EX2 Several aquatic species were protected from some sort of danger by the property of immersion. Cassava feared what might happen if they ever returned to the planet's surface.
Several aquatic species were protected from ghost matter by the property of immersion. Cassava feared what might happen if they ever returned to the planet's surface. COMET_INTERIOR_X3
DSS_B EX3 Cassava was relieved that Giant's Deep's thick clouds had protected the native species from harm.
